During 2019, on their way to winning the World Series, one of the players named Brian Dozier spent hours learning all the words to the song from his Hispanic teammates during the long trips they took to play other teams. As they started winning playoff series the players would hold wild celebrations in their locker room, pouring beer and champagne, and Dozier started stripping off his shirt as he swigged beer and sang along with the entire song as it played in the background. Even during the triumphant parade through Washington DC to congratulate the team and thank the fans this song was played, and Dozier stripped off his shirt and sang along to it with the rest of his teammates who knew the words. It was magic. 

Brian is retired now, but this season after every game one can hear the song being played on the public address system as we leave the stadium. Many fans have no idea what the words mean, but they love that song because it reminds them of a beautiful, improbable, and ultimately successful march to the World Championship.
